title: Trump's tariffs are a blow for Vietnam's economic ambitions
snippets: US exports have driven the economic success of countries like Vietnam and Cambodia.
summary: The economic growth of Vietnam and Cambodia has been significantly bolstered by exports to the United States. This trade dynamic has played a crucial role in the economic success of these countries.
titles: Trump's tariffs are a blow for Vietnam's economic ambitions

title: Know their Names: The Gaza Red Crescent paramedics Israel attacked
snippets: On March 23, Israeli forces killed a group of Palestinian rescue workers in Rafah, Gaza. Here are their stories.
summary: On March 23, Israeli forces killed a group of Palestinian rescue workers in Rafah, located in the Gaza Strip. This incident has brought attention to the ongoing conflict in the region.
titles: Know their Names: The Gaza Red Crescent paramedics Israel attacked

title: US “reciprocal tariffs” will ultimately backfire
snippets: The trade and tariff wars have no winners.
summary: The trade and tariff wars, characterized by countries imposing tariffs on each other's goods, have been widely regarded as having no winners. These economic conflicts lead to increased prices for consumers, disruptions in global supply chains, and strained international relations, ultimately harming economies worldwide.
titles: US “reciprocal tariffs” will ultimately backfire

title: South Sudanese children die as US aid cuts shutter medical services: NGO
snippets: US aid cuts force South Sudanese clinics to close, leaving cholera patients dead on a desperate trek for medical care.
summary: US aid cuts have led to the closure of clinics in South Sudan, resulting in cholera patients dying as they seek medical care elsewhere. This situation underscores the direct impact of reduced financial support on healthcare availability and patient survival in the region.
titles: South Sudanese children die as US aid cuts shutter medical services: NGO

title: Luka Doncic ejected; Lakers lose to Thunder as Shai scores 42
snippets: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander dominated for Oklahoma City in a game where Lakers' Luka Doncic was ejected late in the contest.
summary: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander led Oklahoma City to victory in a game marked by the late ejection of Lakers' star Luka Doncic.
titles: Luka Doncic ejected; Lakers lose to Thunder as Shai scores 42

title: Blue Jays' Single-A affiliate sets single-game Minor League Baseball record by drawing 22 walks
snippets: The Dunedin Blue Jays drew four consecutive bases-loaded walks at one point
summary: During a game, the Dunedin Blue Jays achieved the unusual feat of drawing four consecutive bases-loaded walks. This event is noteworthy as it demonstrates both a disciplined approach at the plate by the Blue Jays' hitters and challenges faced by the opposing team's pitchers in controlling their pitches under pressure.
titles: Blue Jays' Single-A affiliate sets single-game Minor League Baseball record by drawing 22 walks

title: Grizz's Wells awake, alert but has broken wrist
snippets: Grizzlies rookie Jaylen Wells is awake, alert and moving his extremities but sustained a broken wrist after a scary fall against the Hornets.
summary: Jaylen Wells, a rookie for the Grizzlies, is conscious and can move his limbs following a severe fall during a game against the Hornets. However, he has suffered a broken wrist due to the incident.
titles: Grizz's Wells awake, alert but has broken wrist

title: Premier League claims fifth Champions League spot after Arsenal beat Real Madrid
snippets: The Premier League have claimed an extra Champions League spot after Arsenal defeated Real Madrid 3-0 in the first-leg of their quarter-final tie on Tuesday night.Declan Rice was in the form of his li...
summary: The Premier League secured an additional Champions League spot following Arsenal's 3-0 victory over Real Madrid in the first leg of their quarter-final match on Tuesday night. Declan Rice was notably in top form during the game. This win has significant implications for the league's representation in future European competitions.
titles: Premier League claims fifth Champions League spot after Arsenal beat Real Madrid

title: “Not a coincidence” – Arteta makes intriguing claim about Arsenal star’s surprise impact vs Real Madrid
snippets: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta made an intriguing comment about the strong performance of Jakub Kiwior against Real Madrid last night.The Gunners earned a memorable 3-0 victory over Los Blancos, with De...
summary: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta praised Jakub Kiwior's performance in their 3-0 win against Real Madrid. The victory was notable, and Arteta's comments highlighted Kiwior's significant contribution to the team's success in the match.
titles: “Not a coincidence” – Arteta makes intriguing claim about Arsenal star’s surprise impact vs Real Madrid

title: “He will be open to a move” – Insider claims England international wants Liverpool move
snippets: Liverpool are looking for new players in the transfer market and they could have a busy summer transfer window.The Reds are looking to make additions to their defense as well as to their attack this s...
summary: Liverpool FC is actively seeking new players for both their defense and attack, indicating a potentially busy summer transfer window. This move aims to strengthen the team's overall performance.
titles: “He will be open to a move” – Insider claims England international wants Liverpool move

title: Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs take effect
snippets: Investors reel as new levies on the EU, China and other major trading partners come into force
summary: New levies imposed on the European Union, China, and other key trading partners have taken effect, causing significant concern among investors. These measures are expected to impact international trade relations and have already influenced market dynamics.
titles: Donald Trump’s sweeping tariffs take effect

title: US Treasuries sell-off deepens as ‘safe haven’ status challenged
snippets: Investors say misfiring ‘basis trades’ piling pressure on US government bond market
summary: Investors have reported that 'basis trades,' which involve simultaneously buying and selling different forms of US government bonds to exploit price differences, are not performing as expected. This misalignment is adding pressure to the US government bond market, affecting its stability and performance.
titles: US Treasuries sell-off deepens as ‘safe haven’ status challenged

title: Companies’ rush to promise new US factories threatened by Trump tariff chaos
snippets: New plants will take years to build and executives are wary of committing while trade policy is unclear
summary: Due to the uncertainty surrounding trade policy, executives are hesitant to commit to the construction of new plants, a process that is expected to take several years. This caution reflects concerns over the potential impacts of future trade policy changes on the viability and profitability of these long-term investments.
titles: Companies’ rush to promise new US factories threatened by Trump tariff chaos

title: It falls to Congress to unravel Trump’s reckless tariff plan
snippets: If Republicans are serious, they should join with Democrats to pass a resolution to fix this crisis
summary: A call to action has been made for Republicans to collaborate with Democrats in passing a resolution aimed at resolving a current crisis. The emphasis is on bipartisan cooperation to address the issue effectively.
titles: It falls to Congress to unravel Trump’s reckless tariff plan

title: UK growth forecasts hit by Trump’s tariffs
snippets: Economists factor in falling confidence and investment leading to job losses and a probable cut in borrowing costs
summary: Economists have observed a decline in confidence and investment, predicting this trend will result in job losses. They anticipate that these developments will likely prompt a reduction in borrowing costs to counteract the negative economic impact.
titles: UK growth forecasts hit by Trump’s tariffs

title: Groundbreaking study reveals changes in brain cell composition and gene activity in Tourette syndrome
snippets: In the first comprehensive, cell-by-cell analysis of brain tissue from individuals with Tourette syndrome, researchers have pinpointed exactly which cells are perturbed and how they malfunction, revealing how different types of brain cells are affected by the condition. Findings from this groundbreaking study provide unprecedented insights into the interplay of different brain cell types in Tourette syndrome, suggesting new therapeutic directions.
summary: Researchers have conducted the first detailed, cell-by-cell analysis of brain tissue from individuals with Tourette syndrome, identifying specific cells that are disrupted and their malfunctions. This groundbreaking study offers new insights into how various brain cell types interact in the condition, paving the way for potential new treatments.
titles: Groundbreaking study reveals changes in brain cell composition and gene activity in Tourette syndrome

title: Space could emerge from time
snippets: An investigation of the changing behaviour of a single quantum bit through time has uncovered a tantalising similarity to the geometry of three-dimensional space
summary: An investigation into a single quantum bit's behavior over time revealed a notable similarity to the geometry of three-dimensional space. This discovery could enhance our understanding of quantum mechanics and its relationship to the universe's structure.
titles: Space could emerge from time

title: Life recovered rapidly at site of dino-killing asteroid: A hydrothermal system may have helped
snippets: About 66 million years ago, an asteroid slammed into the planet, wiping out all non-avian dinosaurs and about 70% of all marine species. But the crater it left behind in the Gulf of Mexico was a literal hotbed for life enriching the overlying ocean for at least 700,000 years, according to new research.
summary: Approximately 66 million years ago, an asteroid impact resulted in the extinction of all non-avian dinosaurs and around 70% of marine species. However, new research indicates that the crater formed in the Gulf of Mexico fostered a rich environment for life, enriching the ocean above it for over 700,000 years.
titles: Life recovered rapidly at site of dino-killing asteroid: A hydrothermal system may have helped

title: Simultaneously burying broadband and electricity could be worth millions to people in MA towns
snippets: When it comes to upgrading electrical and broadband infrastructure, new research shows that a 'dig once' approach is nearly 40% more cost effective than replacing them separately. The study also found that the greatest benefit comes from proactively undergrounding lines that are currently above ground, even if lines haven't reached the end of their usefulness.
summary: New research indicates that upgrading electrical and broadband infrastructure simultaneously, known as the 'dig once' method, is almost 40% more cost-effective than updating them separately. The study highlights that the most significant savings come from moving existing above-ground lines underground proactively, before they are due for replacement. This approach not only reduces costs but also potentially enhances the longevity and reliability of the infrastructure.
titles: Simultaneously burying broadband and electricity could be worth millions to people in MA towns

title: New research finds fluorescence in feathers of long-eared owls
snippets: Researchers report their discovery of fluorescent pigments in the feathers of Long-eared Owls, that can only be seen by humans with the help of ultraviolet light.
summary: Researchers have discovered fluorescent pigments in the feathers of Long-eared Owls, which are visible to humans only when illuminated with ultraviolet light. This finding adds to the understanding of owl biology and suggests the presence of visual signals in these birds that are not perceivable by humans without technological assistance.
titles: New research finds fluorescence in feathers of long-eared owls
